Description: Pair of iron armlets with oval plates in front.
Curator's comments: Slip reads: "Central Africa." with "Bari, Sudan" added later. Also "St.904" and "Cat.Jomard collection, Ethiopia". This is Q, nos.2 and 3, in Steinhauer's 1862 catalogue of the Christy collection: "Two iron armlets, a fine manufacture by the king's smith at Berr or Barry; they give a good idea of the common civilisation of the Barry Negroes, who live on the shores of the White Nile (Bahr-el-Abiad)." Jomard was one of the savants on Napoleon's expedition to Egypt in 1798, which give an approximate date for these armlets.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006/7, Kenya, Nairobi Gallery, Hazina: Traditions, Trade and Transitions in Eastern Africa
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Edme Francois Jomard (auction sale Paris 1863)
